org.gearvrf

Class GVRShader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.GVRShader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GVRBoundingBoxShader, GVRColorBlendShader, GVRHorizontalFlipShader, GVROESHorizontalStereoShader, GVROESVerticalStereoShader, GVRShaderTemplate, GVRVerticalFlipShader, YuvNv21ToRgbShader

    public class GVRShader
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates a vertex and fragment shader from the sources provided.

    This class allows you to define your own custom shader and introduce it into GearVRF. Each shader generated has a unique signature so that the same shader will not be generated twice. For shaders derived directly from GVRShader, the signature is the simple Java class name.

    The shader also defines descriptors that define the names and types of all the uniforms, textures and vertex attributes used by the shader. For uniforms and attributes, each entry is a float or integer type, an optional count and the name of the uniform (e.g. "float3 diffuse_color, float specular_exponent, int is_enabled". For textures, the descriptor contains the sampler type followed by the name: (e.g. "sampler2D u_texture; samplerCube u_cubemap")

    Shaders derived from GVRShader cannot have variants and they ignore light sources in the scene. To generate a more complex shader which has multiple variants depending on what meshes, materials and light sources it is used with, you can derive from @{link GVRShaderTemplate}

    See Also:
    GVRShaderTemplate

    • Constructor Detail

      • GVRShader

        public GVRShader(java.lang.String uniformDescriptor,
                 java.lang.String textureDescriptor,
                 java.lang.String vertexDescriptor)
        Construct a shader using GLSL version 100. To make a shader for another version use the other form of the constructor.
        Parameters:
        uniformDescriptor - string describing uniform names and types e.g. "float4 diffuse_color, float4 specular_color, float specular_exponent"
        textureDescriptor - string describing texture names and types e.g. "sampler2D diffuseTexture, sampler2D specularTexture"
        vertexDescriptor - string describing vertex attributes and types e.g. "float3 a_position, float2 a_texcoord"

      • GVRShader

        public GVRShader(java.lang.String uniformDescriptor,
                 java.lang.String textureDescriptor,
                 java.lang.String vertexDescriptor,
                 GVRShader.GLSLESVersion glslVersion)
        Construct a shader using specified GLSL version
        Parameters:
        uniformDescriptor - string describing uniform names and types e.g. "float4 diffuse_color, float4 specular_color, float specular_exponent"
        textureDescriptor - string describing texture names and types e.g. "sampler2D diffuseTexture, sampler2D specularTexture"
        vertexDescriptor - string describing vertex attributes and types e.g. "float3 a_position, float2 a_texcoord" string describing uniform names and types
        glslVersion - GLSL version (e.g. GLSLESVersion.V300)

    • Method Detail

      • hasVariants

        public boolean hasVariants()
        Check if this shader template generates variants. If a shader template generates variants, the specific vertex and fragment shader to use cannot be determined until the mesh, the material and lights are known. If the shader template only makes a single shader, the vertex and fragment shader programs can be generated immediately.
        Returns:
        true if this template generates variants, false if only a single shader can be generated.
        See Also:
        GVRRenderData

      • usesLights

        public boolean usesLights()
        Check if this shader template uses light sources. If a shader template uses light sources, the specific vertex and fragment shader to use cannot be generated until all light sources are known. If the shader ignores lighting, it will not need to be regenerated if lights are added or removed from the scene.
        See Also:
        hasVariants()

      • getUniformDescriptor

        public java.lang.String getUniformDescriptor()
        Get the string describing the shader uniforms. Each uniform is a fixed number of integer or float values. It is described with the type ("int" or "float") immediately followed by the size (a small integer) a space and then the name of uniform in the shader (e.g. "int enabled, float3 color") Spaces, commas, and other punctuation are ignored.
        Returns:
        String with descriptor. GVRLightBase.getUniformDescriptor() }

      • getVertexDescriptor

        public java.lang.String getVertexDescriptor()
        Get the string describing the vertex attributes used by this shader. Each vertex attribute represents a channel of float or int vectors. It is described with the type ("int" or "float") immediately followed by the size (a small integer) a space and then the name of the vertex attribute in the shader (e.g. "float3 a_position, float23 a_texcoord") Spaces, commas, and other punctuation are ignored.
        Returns:
        String with uniform descriptor. GVRLightBase.getVertexDescriptor() }

      • getTextureDescriptor

        public java.lang.String getTextureDescriptor()
        Get the string describing the textures used by this shader. A texture is described with the sampler type (e.g. "sampler2D" or "samplerCube") a space and then the name of the sampler in the shader. (e.g. "sampler2D u_texture") Spaces, commas, and other punctuation are ignored.
        Returns:
        String with uniform descriptor.

      • generateSignature

        public java.lang.String generateSignature(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> defined,
                                          GVRLightBase[] lightlist)
        Create a unique signature for this shader. The signature for simple shaders is just the class name. For the more complex shaders generated by GVRShaderTemplate the signature includes information about the vertex attributes, uniforms, textures and lights used by the shader variant.
        Parameters:
        defined - names to be defined for this shader
        Returns:
        string signature for shader
        See Also:
        GVRShaderTemplate

      • setMaterialDefaults

        protected void setMaterialDefaults(GVRShaderData material)
        Sets the default values for material data used by the shader. Subclasses can override this function to provide values for uniforms used by the material that are required by this shader. This function is called whenever a GVRMaterial is created that uses this shader class.
        Parameters:
        material - the material whose values should be set
        See Also:
        GVRMaterial

      • bindShader

        public int bindShader(GVRContext context,
                      IRenderable rdata,
                      GVRScene scene,
                      boolean isMultiview)
        Select the specific vertex and fragment shader to use. The shader template is used to generate the sources for the vertex and fragment shader based on the vertex, material and light properties. This function may compile the shader if it does not already exist.
        Parameters:
        context - GVRContext
        rdata - renderable entity with mesh and rendering options
        scene - list of light sources

      • bindShader

        public int bindShader(GVRContext context,
                      GVRShaderData material,
                      java.lang.String vertexDesc)
        Select the specific vertex and fragment shader to use with this material. The shader template is used to generate the sources for the vertex and fragment shader based on the material properties only. It will ignore the mesh attributes and all lights.
        Parameters:
        context - GVRContext
        material - material to use with the shader
        Returns:
        ID of vertex/fragment shader set

      • bindShader

        public int bindShader(GVRContext context,
                      GVRShaderManager shaderManager)
        Select the specific vertex and fragment shader to use with a shader template that does not generate variants. This is the only way to bind a post-effect shader (because it does not have a material).
        Parameters:
        context - GVRContext
        shaderManager - shader manager to use
        Returns:
        ID of vertex/fragment shader set or 0 if shader template has variants.
        See Also:
        GVRContext.getMaterialShaderManager()

      • replaceTransforms

        protected java.lang.String replaceTransforms(java.lang.String code)
        Replaces @MATRIX_UNIFORMS in shader source with the proper transform uniform declarations.
        Parameters:
        code - shader source code
        Returns:
        shader source with transform uniform declarations added

      • getSegment

        protected java.lang.String getSegment(java.lang.String name)
        Get the designated shader segment.
        Parameters:
        name - string name of shader segment
        Returns:
        source code for segment or null if none exists. GVRShaderTemplate.setSegment(String, String)

      • setSegment

        protected void setSegment(java.lang.String segmentName,
                          java.lang.String shaderSource)
        Attach a named shader segment. Shader segment names should start with either "Vertex" or "Fragment" to designate which type of shader the code belongs with. Both vertex and fragment shaders can have more than one code segment contribute to the final shader.
        Parameters:
        segmentName - name associated with shader segment
        shaderSource - String with shader source code
